fields.description:
I am the member of several bitbucket projects.

If I manually enter the uri endpoint https://bitbucket.org/<projectname> I view all repositories.

Upon clicking the main dashboard button, I am redirected to https://bitbucket.org/ and the projects directory is now empty.
fields.summary: Bit Bucket Projects: Empty Unless Manual

fields.description:
With the current search, you can search for a file extension with {{ext:}}.  But I want to search for a file by name across all repositories.  Like {{Dockerfile}}, which has no extension.

If I search for it with no qualifiers, it does not show the files with that name -- just the files that contain the text {{Dockerfile}}.

How about a {{name:}} command, or just also include files with the name that matches the search term.
fields.summary: Search for file by name

fields.description:
Few days ago I found there are users whose doesn't belong to our company in *Users on plan* section under our team *Settings*.

Total number of users above the table is correct, but in table there is much more users than only our members.

!2916954655-chrome_2018-01-17_17-19-29.png|thumbnail!

All the *Staff users* have access for {{bitbucket:bitbucket-staff}} under {{View access}} link in table.
fields.summary: Unknown staff users started to show in "User on Plan" Settings

fields.description:
Hello,

While merging pull request on certain repository, merge with Master not working.\\
After clicking Merge button, the animation keeps on rotating but no merge happens.

Affecting the development and very critical
fields.summary: Pull request not merging with Master on certain repositories

fields.description:
Hello,

We have always experienced relatively slow transfer on Repo Pulls to our build server, {this is not a result of our own bandwidth].

However since the issues the other week our Repo pulls have gone from an exceptionally long 45 minutes for 300Mb to an appalling 134 minutes.
fields.summary: Repo Pull Time

fields.description:
Hi

When i try to edit the read.me file , the following error is thrown\\
"We had trouble committing your changes"
fields.summary: cannot commit read.me file

fields.description:
Hi All

Running on ALPHA.

The following error is displayed when I add a tag for a public image which is on the docker repo.

Without the tag I get the latest version 1.0.0 which I don't want.

Are tags supported on definitions?

*Config*

{code}
#!yml


definitions:
  services:
    zookeeper:
      image: wurstmeister/zookeeper:0.10.2.1
    kafka:
      image: wurstmeister/kafka:0.10.2.1
      environment:
        KAFKA_ADVERTISED_HOST_NAME: "localhost"
        KAFKA_ADVERTISED_PORT: "9092"
        KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT: localhost:2181
{code}

*Error*

rpc error: code = Unknown desc = Tag 0.10.2.1 not found in repository docker.io/wurstmeister/zookeeper
fields.summary: Error when adding a image tag for a pipeline definition

fields.description:
Context: we have a pipelines build that automatically publishes test cases when you raise a PR. To get that URL we currently have to go find the build number and update the description. Then if we push updates (invalidating the test cases) we have to update the link(s) to point to the next build's output, etc. Also if reviewers don't notice the very-subtle build status, they go to the URL before it's ready (build status being too subtle is a different issue).

*What would be awesome*: the ability to log information from Pipelines into a panel on the Pull Request screen.

In our case that would mean logging the test URL after the test cases have been deployed. In one hit that would provide the URL, make build status more promient, and auto-update for any subsequent builds.

*What would still help*: it would help even to just have an option to make Pipelines more prominent in some projects, ideally including the build number. It would also be cool to have an option to delay PR notifications until a successful build has run. (ie. The same panel that's on the project's homepage, but scoped to the PR's branch)
fields.summary: On pull request page, show links or messages from related Pipelines builds

fields.description:
We will see that sometimes when the original webhook times out or fails, but the retry is successful,  customer experiences duplicate  builds triggered on the same commit SHA.

We need a mechanism in place that will prevent duplicate events
fields.summary: Webhooks failures cause duplicate Pipelines builds (BP-1331)

fields.description:
We'd like the ability to define environment variables with more granularity than at the repository level.

Ideally we'd like the option to specify environment variables at a step level and a pipeline level. Something akin to CIrcleCI - https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/env-vars/

This would support having secure environment variables with different credentials for each deployment environment.
fields.summary: Environment variables with different values for each deployment environment

fields.description: In Go, vendor changes in broader pull requests can modify hundreds of files.  This has an adverse effect on the UI performance, and readability of the pull request for the reviewer.  I'd like to propose that in Go tagged repositories that the vendor directory is only populated in the pull request if the reviewer clicks to display the vendor changes.
fields.summary: For Go language repo pull requests, the vendor directory should only populate if clicked.

fields.description:
Last week when I was trying to push, I got an error message which was saying that Bitbucket was recovering from an internal crash. Since then no users can no longer push to the master branch of git@bitbucket.org:digitalur/configuration_kpif.git. The error message is pasted below. From what I found this can only be fixed by bitbucket staff. Thanks in advance.

{code}
#!bash
$ git push
Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: error: cannot lock ref 'refs/heads/master': Unable to create '/data/c01/n07/p/vp0657/data/d-297/r-28982297/refs/heads/master.lock': File exists.
remote:
remote: If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
remote: git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
remote: process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
To bitbucket.org:digitalur/configuration_kpif.git
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (failed to update ref)
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:digitalur/configuration_kpif.git'

$ git remote -v
origin	git@bitbucket.org:digitalur/configuration_kpif.git (fetch)
origin	git@bitbucket.org:digitalur/configuration_kpif.git (push)
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot push to master branch because of a lock file on the server

We also used the resent invitation button but did not succeed. Also, re-invited him did not help either as well as self registration from his side.

Please help as soon as you can.

Thank you.

fields.description:
Unable to fetch the list of modified files and their individual changes in API version 2.0 as we can see the same requirement completed in API 1.0 using diffstat command.

Please suggest the way to find the stats of a commit in API 2.0

or API 2.0 should include diff and diffstat for getting JSON output instead of raw text.

When I try to create or edit a SQL file in my repository and commit it online from Bitbucket UI, I get the error 'We had trouble committing your changes.'

To generate back:

Step 1: Create or modify a file with '.sql' extension

Step 2: Commit it online with Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
I received two emails in succession. Seems like there is a mismatch between subject text and the text in the message body.

h2. First email
* Subject: [Bitbucket] Two-step recovery codes *regenerated*
* Body: ... Two-step recovery codes for account have been *downloaded*. ...

h2. Second email
* Subject: [Bitbucket] Two-step recovery codes *downloaded*
* Body: ... Two-step recovery codes for account have been *regenerated*. ...

Just wanted to report this since it looked like a bug that is easy to miss and ignore :)
fields.summary: Possible bug with Two-step email notifications
Allow mounting subdirectories of $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR for Docker run.
Wiki - cannot edit or create pages

fields.description:
By default, maven creates process forks for running tests. When I run such a maven build on Bitbucket Pipelines, I get the following error:

{code}
[ERROR] Please refer to /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/persistence/target/failsafe-reports for the individual test results.
[ERROR] Please refer to dump files (if any exist) [date]-jvmRun[N].dump, [date].dumpstream and [date]-jvmRun[N].dumpstream.
[ERROR] org.apache.maven.surefire.booter.SurefireBooterForkException: The forked VM terminated without properly saying goodbye. VM crash or System.exit called?
[ERROR] Command was /bin/sh -c cd /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/persistence && /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.8-openjdk/jre/bin/java -jar /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/persistence/target/surefire/surefirebooter6575592553579584591.jar /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/persistence/target/surefire 2018-01-13T12-32-13_138-jvmRun1 surefire4725132626445902495tmp surefire_05599682100559927811tmp
[ERROR] Error occurred in starting fork, check output in log
[ERROR] Process Exit Code: 1
{code}

Is Bitbucket Pipelines preventing the creation of process forks or killing forks automatically? Is there any way of accessing the failsafe-reports under /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/persistence/target/failsafe-reports? These might reveal more details about the problem.
fields.summary: maven-failsafe-plugin fails on fork creation

fields.description:
I am running a maven build that uses io.fabric8:docker-maven-plugin:0.23.0 to spawn docker containers for integration testing during {{mvn install}}. This works fine locally, but when executed with Bitbucket Pipelines, I get the following error:

{code}
[INFO] DOCKER> Pulling from library/postgres
#
[INFO] DOCKER> Digest: sha256:d6150452877361e26d0fd178d278af8f80d59c75cbb5c2413cfb4fdb5ed4f750
[INFO] DOCKER> Status: Downloaded newer image for postgres:10-alpine
[INFO] DOCKER> Pulled postgres:10-alpine in 2 seconds 
[ERROR] DOCKER> Error occurred during container startup, shutting down...
[ERROR] DOCKER> I/O Error [Unable to create container for [postgres:10-alpine] : authorization denied by plugin pipelines: Command not supported. (Forbidden: 403)]
{code}

So it seems that docker itself is working since the image is fetched successfully but when it comes to actually starting a container, the pipelines plugin forbids the operation.\\
On the contrary, a literal {{docker run -d postgres:10}} inside my pipeline step works.
fields.summary: Maven fabric8 plugin fails to run docker container in pipeline
Cross reference issue only repository from commits in code repository

fields.description:
Hi,

We have a limit of 2GB for our repo and our repository is 1.4GB - but suddenly after a small push of code changes our repo is now 2.8GB???

Is this because of the maintenance going on right now?

This means that we cannot push changes anymore because we are over the limit of 2.8GB

Hoping this will resolve itself??
fields.summary: Repository size suddenly doubled in size an hour ago?!!! And is now readonly

fields.description: "Leave Team" button will not appear in Member navigation if users which listed in a user group without team permission such as "Create repositories" or "Administer team".
fields.summary: "Leave Team" button not appear for users who listed in users group without team permission

fields.description:
Our pipeline pushes docker image to a private owned registry. It has been working until few days ago. Docker pushes started failing due to *unauthorized: authentication required* errors.

Please see log as following:

{code}
#!shell

docker login --username=$CCE_REGISTRY_UNAME --password=$CCE_REGISTRY_PWD <registry>
9s

+ docker login --username=$BAIDU_CCE_REGISTRY_UNAME --password=$BAIDU_CCE_REGISTRY_PWD <registry>
Login Succeeded
docker build -t <registry>/<namespace>/<image>:$BITBUCKET_TAG .
18s
docker push <registry>/<namespace>/<image>:$BITBUCKET_TAG
30m 16s

+ docker push <registry>/<namespace>/<image>:$BITBUCKET_TAG
The push refers to a repository [<registry>/<namespace>/<image>]
d7c237ef87fc: Preparing
69cc5717c281: Preparing
5b1e27e74327: Preparing
04a094fe844e: Preparing
5b1e27e74327: Pushed
04a094fe844e: Pushed
69cc5717c281: Retrying in 5 seconds
69cc5717c281: Retrying in 4 seconds
69cc5717c281: Retrying in 3 seconds
69cc5717c281: Retrying in 2 seconds
69cc5717c281: Retrying in 1 second
69cc5717c281: Pushed
unauthorized: authentication required

{code}

As you can see, login was successful, it managed to push some part of the image, then eventually failed due to *unauthorized: authentication required*.

Did anything change recently that could cause this? Can you help debugging on this?

_(Pushing from localhost using the exact same steps works fine)_
fields.summary: Docker push failed: unauthorized: authentication required

fields.description:
User unable to add new users if there's an addition whitespace at the end of username or email address while adding a user to a Team's users group.\\
After click *Add* button, the loading icon will keep spinning and both "Add"&"Cancel" button will be disabled.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Navigate to https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<Team-Username>/groups/
# Click "Add member"
# Enter email address with an addition whitespace at the end
# Click the "Add" button
fields.summary: Ignore additional white-space while adding users to groups

fields.description:
When creating a pull request, we have the option to add a user by username or full name.

If the full name is only two characters, it does not show up. However when we enter the username of the account, we're able to show the correct user. Subsequently by entering two characters does show the correct user.

Upon refreshing the page and entering the two characters, it does not show the user. The user being added which has two characters as the Full Name does have access to the repository.

Same issue occurs when adding a reviewer in a Pull Request. Please refer to the screenshot below.

# It gives us the option to add "username or fullname".

!1565261012-1.PNG|thumbnail!

# It does not recognize the entered fullname.

!3441025291-2.PNG|thumbnail!

# It recognizes the username entered

!1948110559-3.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Two character full names does not show up when adding a default reviewer

fields.description: Right now when I run pipelines, the default PIP version is 7.1.2 when it should be 9.0.1
fields.summary: Bitbucket pip version is ancient and should be updated to 9.0.1

fields.description:
Using [AdBlock|https://www.getadblock.com/] extension in Chrome I cannot expand pull request code using the ... "show more lines" buttons.

!2448732805-Screenshot%20at%20Jan%2011%2012-54-48.png|thumbnail!

Seems to be a fairly new defect; I use this functionality frequently and have been using the same browser setup for a long time.

h2. Versions
*Chrome*: Version 63.0.3239.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)\\
*AdBlock*: Version: 3.22.1

h2. Work around
Whitelist {{bitbucket.org/*}} in the AdBlock plugin.
fields.summary: AdBlock prevents code form being expanded in pull requests

fields.description:
It is a really big merge between two branches. Even after refreshing, Bitbucket still gives this message (This merge is too large to display). And it doesn't even show the filenames involved.

How can we resolve this? Thank you.
fields.summary: This merge is too large to display

fields.description:
Hi.

One of our developers just set up a new account and reset the password and received an email with the following contents.

=== email start ===\\
Your Atlassian account password has changed

Hi {password},

We’re confirming that you changed your Atlassian account password for {email-address}.

If you didn't make this change, let us know immediately.

Cheers,\\
The Atlassians\\
=== email end===

I've replaced the original password and email with {password} and {email-address} respectively.

It looks like someone has goofed and printed the password, rather than the username in the message. :)
fields.summary: Password being exposed in password changeconfirmation email.

fields.description: It would be nice to have a collapse button on each diff in a pull request to be able to collapse or expand as need.  Especially for diffs in snap shot tests that are quite large and require a lot of scrolling before reaching the next diff in the pull request..
fields.summary: Ability to collapse/expand pull request diffs

fields.description:
When checking out the status page during the storage layer issues of January 9 2018, i noticed that the system metric graphs are not autoscaling. This means that you cannot see the whole graph if the values are worse that the top value (see screenshot attached).

I asked a collegue to check if he has the same issue on the status page, and he confirmed that the graphs are {{cut down}}.

!502090465-status_graph_autoscaling.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: There is no autoscaling on the performance graphs of status.bitbucket.org

Hi\\
As today we get the following errors on one of our repositories, this is a major blocker for us since we can't deploy our application!

Fetching origin\\
remote: Counting objects: 220, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (220/220), done.\\

error: Could not fetch origin

Regards\\
Erik

fields.description:
Repository size reached 1GB soft-limit should notify users by email as mentioned in this documentation: [What kind of limits do you have on repository/file/upload size?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-kind-of-limits-do-you-have-on-repository-file-upload-size-273877699.html]

However, users did not receive email notification about repository size reached 1GB soft-limit.
fields.summary: Not sending email notification regards exceed repository size soft limit.

fields.description:
Users can only remove PR's reviewer by clicking *Edit* to edit the PR.

When a user added to a PR  reviewer of a public repository which the user has no write access, it's not possible for the user to remove themselves from the PR.\\
Since users with Read-only access can't remove themselves from the PR, the PR will show on customer's dashboard until it's merged or declined.

Hence, it will be best that users can remove themselves as PR reviewer.
fields.summary: Allow users with Read-only access to remove themselves as PR reviewer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
wiki clone using HTTPS doesn't fetch current status

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# clone a wiki via HTTPS using the default code provided, like

{code}
git clone https://<user>@bitbucket.org/<owner>/<slug>.git/wiki
{code}

h3. Expected Results
current files will be cloned

h3. Actual Results
only old files are cloned

h3. Notes
no relationship with https://status.bitbucket.org/incidents/z029156p1svh

h3. Workaround
* clone via SSH
fields.summary: wiki clone using HTTPS doesn't fetch current status

fields.description:
We are using Bitbucket Cloud for internal projects. To help us guard our intellectual property it would be safer to have an option at the team level to block all anonymous access instead of having to mark each repository as private. This would also allow us to better manage read access to repositories (and projects in the future if BCLOUD-13202 gets implemented).

Bitbucket Server already has a concept of global permissions, if we could inherit that to be an account/team-level options that would be great.
fields.summary: Option to disable public access to all projects and repositories at team level

fields.description:
More than 24 hours from the beginning of the issue and we cannot deploy our code because bitbucket is not working properly.

Do you recommend us change our repos to gitlab?
fields.summary: Imposible to deploy

fields.description:
git push origin master is giving response:\\
! [remote rejected] master -> master (failed to update ref)\\
Although it was working fine before bitbucket server issues.\\
Neither can commit file online from bitbucket UI
fields.summary: Unable to push committed changes to a particular repository.

fields.description: Since yesterday on all branches the pipelines are not triggered anymore.
fields.summary: Pipeline are not processing on new commit

fields.description:
Hello,\\
we're planning to use pipelines to deploy to Salesforce.\\
My concern is that pipeline configuration files stored in each branch, containing the target Salesforce environment, could potentially be updated through a Pull Request: even if I am the only one allowed to merge on our UAT and Production environments, if a developer makes a mistake and pushes a change to a pipeline configuration file via Pull Request and I fail to identify it among the list of changes, we could end up in a situation in which I run the deployment pipeline for UAT but, instead, the content gets deployed to Salesforce Production.\\
We'd therefore need to have something that makes files read-only in a branch, or have some feature that, for instance, prevents from merging a Pull Request if it lists a change on a particular file.
fields.summary: Secure pipeline configuration files
Ability to search or filter files on the Downloads page

fields.description:
Hello,

Still having the same issue since yesterday ! HTTP : 500 (Internal Server Error) When pushing to Repo.

Any help ?

Thank you !
fields.summary: HTTP : 500 (Internal Server Error) When pushing to Repo

fields.description: Today, BitBucket is extremely unstable. On its status page, it shows webhooks as "Operational", but they are not: when I push changes to any repository, my CircleCI hooks are not being triggered at all...
fields.summary: Webhooks not being triggered

fields.description:
Previously, when a remote branch received new commits, any open pull requests with that branch as it source would update automatically to include the new commits.

Now, when a branch is updated the pull request shows a popup box over the "Edit" button saying the PR needs to be updated.

!1265381462-Screen%20Shot%202018-01-09%20at%2011.31.37%20AM.png|thumbnail!

Not sure what the reasoning is for this, but our whole team would love to see this functionality restored.
fields.summary: Pull requests no longer update automatically

fields.description:
The BB markdown syntax guide (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/markdown-syntax-guide-776639995.html) does not conform to the cited CommonMark specs with regard to nested lists. CommonMark allows for only 2 spaces for sub lists, however Bitbucket requires 4 spaces. This creates significant output formatting issues when bringing in documents from other sources (most of which only use 2 spaces for sub lists).

Some examples of significant organizations that follow the two-space rule:

* Stack overflow
* GitHub
* CommonMark

Please fix the requirement and add Bitbucket to the list.

----
{code}
* item 1
* item 2
  * sub-item 1
  * sub-item 2
* item 3
{code}

should properly render a nested list under {{item 2}}
fields.summary: Bitbucket Markdown does not conform to the current CommonMark spec, per docs

fields.description:
We are receiving error 400 trying to download the tar.gz with the last version of our code.\\
we run a curl command like this:\\
curl --insecure  -C - --retry 5 --user ourUser https://bitbucket.org/<owner>/<ourRepo>/get/tip.tar.gz -o tip.tar.gz

we receive "randomly" this error dependes of the moment it works or not, we experiment this issue especially with the biggest repository of our company.

We have a workaround put the curl in a loop and checking the result till the download works well, normally at second try it works
fields.summary: Error 400 trying download the tip.tar.gz with our repository

fields.description:
# Git Bash cmd: "git clone https://user@bitbucket.org/*.git"
# Error: "fatal: unable to access 'https://user@bitbucket.org/*.git': The requested URL returned error: 500

* I can login to "https://id.atlassian.com"
* "https://status.bitbucket.org/" informed me of degraded performance, but my colleagues are not seeing this. See attached png files

Initially could not log in to the BitBucket.org website, but now it is okay.
fields.summary: The requested URL returned error: 500 for git clone
Site slowing to a crawl, error 500 everywhere

fields.description:
is it normal for the bitbucket website to take 5 seconds each time I click on stuff?

https://imgur.com/a/I1HdNhttps://imgur.com/a/I1HdN

on a good day it takes 2.6 seconds (roughly), if i disable cache it's 4 - 5 seconds, but i'm personally ok with first time loads being really slow (no more than 10 seconds, that would be crazy).

I just feel like interacting with the website is really sluggish (thankfully I don't have to use the website that often though, mainly just use git)

this probably isn't going to reach anyone, but hoping for the best anyways!
fields.summary: website is really slow?

fields.description: The "Compare branches or Tags" page has a "Merge" button but it would be nice to have a "Create a Pull Request" button as well which pre-populates the source and destination branches.
fields.summary: Add a "Create a Pull Request" button on the Compare branches page

fields.description:
Removing Trello add-ons on *Manage integrations* in individual or team account settings will prompt a message "Add-on Trello has been removed. You may need to refresh the page to see changes to navigation."

After refresh, the *Boards* navigation still appears in the repository.

Note: It is possible to remove Trello Boards navigation panel in the repository settings, but is not possible to remove it in account settings "Manage Integration".

Example:

If you had disabled Trello on repository settings, your repository "Boards" option on left-panel will disappear. After that, if you remove Trello add-ons on Account Settings, the "Boards" options will appear back on the left-panel of the repository

Steps to reproduce:

# Go any repository settings, disable Trello and refresh
# "Boards" option will disappear on left-panel
# Go to account settings and click *Manage Integration*
# Remove Trello add-ons
# Back to the repository and "Boards" option will appear on left-panel.
fields.summary: "Boards" option does not get removed after removing Trello add-ons

fields.description: When you're an administrator, it's possible to remove user and group access entirely on a repo, making the repository inaccessible for the administrators of the team. We should add in a check to prevent administrators from removing the administration group, for example.
fields.summary: Prevent administrators from losing repository access

fields.description:
Using Firefox 57.0.4 (64 bits) on Windows, every time I select the WYSIWYG editor to create a Pull Request or edit an existing one, when focusing the cursor on the textarea of the editor, the WISYWIG bar dissapears from the screen and leaves no option to use any of the buttons.

!1776657519-wysiwyg-bug.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Firefox: WYSIWYG editor bar dissapears when textarea is on focus

fields.summary: Commit graph not showing branch name

fields.description:
My "recent activity" show correct user with the commit message. but the commits page shows different user. This is really concerning pls fix this at the earliest..

My commits page is showing a unrelated user "kiran.b.h"

fields.description:
Hi, we have a respository I can not push because of error remote: repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit).

Thanks
fields.summary: Cant push - repository size limit hit(2GB)

fields.description: It would be nice to have a wiki or readme you can upload at the project level rather than only the repository.
fields.summary: Project wiki

fields.description:
If use @ mentions in textarea (composing comments mode) of bitbucket review, then it suggests only teammates of current organization, which is expected. But if submit a comment containing not existing member name then it will expand to login mention though. So, using {{@param}} in text, will lead to appearing some strange names in comments.

According to [support ticket|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-69792], it appears not only in PR review.
fields.summary: Scope issue on expanding @ mentions in comments

fields.description: When I click webhooks or pipeline tab I can't see anything in the right hand side pane. It's empty. I inspected it with developer tools and saw an error as shown in attached images
fields.summary: Can't access Webhooks or pipeline

fields.description: I cannot find my recent commits and the branch in my repo cannot create a pull request. it is shown no changes While actually it shows 2 commits ahead.
fields.summary: Missing recent commits

fields.description:
I've checked folder permissions and made sure bitbucket was running under the atlbitbucket user.

*atlassian-bitbucket.log*

{code}
#!java

fields.summary: The avatar could not be saved

fields.description: We would like to be able to lock a branch or essentially archive it after work on it has been completed. We keep branches after merging but do not want more work done after merge.
fields.summary: Branch locking

fields.description:
The Build Teardown section does not always display on failed steps. This is a problem when trying to configure test reporting based on the logging.

The Test Report parsing itself _will_ run. The absence of any reports suggests the parser could not find an XML file in an expected directory. But it is difficult to debug this without feedback in the Build Teardown logs.
fields.summary: Build Teardown does not always show

fields.description:
Hi,

Could we please show the name of the person who last committed to a branch in the Branches listing page:

https://bitbucket.org/my_org/my_repo/branches/

What I want to see easily are the branches that I've worked or am working on. I know that sometimes they are shared but mostly they're just mine.

Showing the user name in a column here against each branch would be really very handy indeed.

With regards, Ian
fields.summary: Show the name of the person who last committed to a branch in the Branches listing page

fields.description:
Issue occurs for specific use case in Safari browser version 11.02 .

In this case, there is a "blurry/fuzzy" effect on the text display for merge window that only occurs in Safari (version 11.02 only)  on OS X 10.11.6 .

Attached screenshots shows an example of comparison of text display of the same repository in Safari 11.02 and Safari 11.0 where the "blurry/fuzzy" effect shows in version 11.02 and not in version 11.0 .

Blurry image with Safari 11.0.2:\\
!286633899-Blurry%20image%20with%20Safari%2011-0-2.png|thumbnail!

Same image with Safari 11.0:\\
!493625759-Same%20image%20with%20Safari%2011-0%20NOT%20Blurry%20.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Blurry/fuzzy" text display in merge window for Safari browser (version 11.02 only)

fields.description:
We have seen a few cases when customer is using a Docker and the process hangs at the start and fails to proceed, unless the user stops it the process times out.\\
Stopping the build and re-running it fixes the issues, need to identify the root cause why this is happening.
fields.summary: Pipelines hangs: occasionally customers will see build hang when using Docker (BP-1268 )
Cannot use env variable with name keyword

fields.description: I use [Monodraw |https://monodraw.helftone.com](an app) to create ascii diagrams.  "ascii" is a misnomer since I do it in unicode.  Unicode ascii diagrams/art aren't spaced properly. They display properly in PyCharm (for example) and in every text editor I've come across.  They also display properly in Gitlab (and it's variants). Bitbucket is the only place I can't use my diagrams.
fields.summary: Unicode characters in code blocks or pre not monospaced

fields.description: I want to completely disable the RSS feed for my Bitbucket repositories.
fields.summary: Ability to disable RSS feed for repositories

fields.description:
If I open repo1 in a browser, then later open repo2, switch back to repo1 and use the sidebar buttons to create a branch, the branch will default to repo2. This is easy to do without noticing the branch name change. This doesn't seem to affect the other repo Actions or Navigation options available from the sidebar.\\
I would expect the create branch button to create a branch from the currently viewed repository (repo1), not some other repository I have open in another tab.
fields.summary: Opening multiple repositories open in a browser makes some actions affect the wrong repo

fields.description:
When I create pull request e.g. from {{feature}} to {{develop}} I will receive webhook everytime branch {{feature}} is updated. But the event will not be emitted when I update {{develop}} branch.

I believe it is desired because on every update of target branch pull request could have different diff, different list of commits.
fields.summary: Missing event pullrequest updated when target branch is updated

fields.description:
*Description -* Commit messages reflect wrong username whereas on commit Id click it gives correct username.

*Steps to recreate -*

* Login
* Click on a project repository and check for username of a commit. (Refer image1)
* Click on its commit Id.
* Check for username of that commit ID. (Refer image2)

*Actual Results -* Username on commit message and that after commit ID click is different.

*Expected Results -* Name of user should be mentioned by whom commit has been made.

*Tested on -* Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Wrong username is reflected in commit messages whereas on clicking commit Id it reflects correct username.

fields.description:
When trying to install the Jira add-on I am getting the following error:

----
Error

The add-on failed to be installed: Error calling uninstalled at URL https://xxx.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall: 401 Client Error: Unauthorized for url: https://xxx.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall

----
Nothing I can do seems to change it. The add-on is not showing in Jira, and I have admin access to Bitbucket & Jira.
fields.summary: Unable to install Jira add-on

fields.description: Reading/showing incorrect results for API call to users permission on boards.  A pop up is saying that the "user is unable to link repos if they don't have invite permissions" on the board, and this code path is seemingly being hit by customers that do have these permissions.
fields.summary: Permission error with power up reading repos from Bitbucket.(BBCC-470)

fields.description:
I'm part of multiple teams and use one Bitbucket account for all of them. When I edit a README on Bitbucket or respond to a Pull Request Bitbucket pulls my primary email from my Atlassian account. This is used in online commits and pull requests.

I have multiple email aliases associated with my Bitbucket account.\\
https://bitbucket.org/account/user/{username}/email/

A useful feature would be able to assign a primary email alias per team. This way my work commits use my work email and my personal commits use my personal email.
fields.summary: Link email alias to Team

fields.description: When you create an account, you can either supply a username/password, or you can delegate account management to google. If you choose google, but later want to control the account directly, there is no way to do so. There should be a feature that allows you to keep an existing bitbucket account but to detach it from google so you can manually control the password.
fields.summary: Allow detaching a Bitbucket account from google control

fields.description:
There are two issues described below; however, I suspect they have the same root cause so I'm lumping them in here.

These may also be symptoms of 6705, if so I'll incorporate these evidence points into that ticket.

Issue BCLOUD-1:

We use bookmarks to track tickets individually as a part of our development process.

For example, if an issue is created BKSTG-1234, a bookmark is created called BKSTG-1234.

Bitbucket only seems to be vaguely aware of bookmarks, leading to some buggy behavior.

For example, let's say we have two tickets:

BKSTG-1234

and

BKSTG-1235

And let's say that the work in BKSTG-1234 is also a part of BKSTG-1235 (but not vice versa).

If BKSTG-1234 is approved through the QA process and therefor "Ready for Merge", in bitbucket the "Merge" button will be instead be shown as "Superseded".

For additional information, we cut all bookmarks off a branch called development and they get eventually merged to default once approved through the QA cycle.

It seems Bitbucket is tracking a Head, not the bookmark. What we really need is for bitbucket to track the bookmark.

Issue BCLOUD-2.

We created a command line to create a Bitbucket PR based on the users active bookmark.

However, bitbucket's API isn't "bookmark aware", which leads us to do something like:

body = {\\
'title': title,\\
'close_source_branch': False,\\
'state': 'OPEN',\\
'summary': {\\
'raw': description,\\
},\\
'source': {\\
'branch': {'name': 'development'},\\
'commit': {'hash': get_bm_hash(bookmark)}\\
},\\
'destination': {\\
'branch': {'name': destination}\\
}\\
}

Note the {{"get_bm_hash"}} function. Really, this should just point to a bookmark name ideally.

What we are looking for:

Bitbucket should be bookmark aware. Pull requests should track bookmarks, not heads or hashes.
fields.summary: Bookmark Support (mercurial)

fields.description:
I've been experimenting with using Bitbucket Pipelines as a build step before deploying to Elastic Beanstalk applications and have greatly enjoyed the experience.

However I am running into an issue when running {{eb deploy}}.

When running {{eb deploy}} my application source is zipped up and uploaded to Elastic Beanstalk for deployment. After this task, the EB CLI then waits for the application to finish updating before exiting the current command. This can waste upwards of 3-4 build minutes on my account.

I'm not sure if this would be on your side, or if I should make a request to AWS to add an improvement to their CLI.

Thank you for your help
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines + Elastic Beanstalk Deploy wastes build minutes

fields.description:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47665860/bitbucket-pipeline-deploy-to-azure-app-service-using-ncftpput-fails-mid-way

I'm having the same problem as these users.

At random times in the ncftpput I will encounter 'Passive mode refused,' then the deployment fails.

I'm using the sample Azure + Pipelines setup, deploying to an Azure Web App.

Any suggestions on where to begin debugging this issue?
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines + Azure: 'Passive mode refused' midway
An error when mapping volume on Docker

fields.description:
I am having problems pushing changes to my repos using ssh. It just stopped working all of a sudden.  I am on an OSX High Sierra.

Disclosure: I am at a public library internet at the moment.

{code}
#!bash
ssh -vT git@bitbucket.org
#output 
OpenSSH_7.6p1, LibreSSL 2.6.2
debug1: Reading configuration data /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/config
debug1: /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/config line 2: Applying options for bitbucket.org
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 48: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org port 22.
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection refused

# I have replaced my username above with [*username*], since I don't want to share that publicly. 
{code}

Below is my config. As stated, I have tried port 443, without much success.

{code}
#!bash

Host bitbucket.org
  HostName bitbucket.org
 # Port 443
  IdentityFile ~/.ssh/bitbucket
  UseKeychain yes

Host github.com
  HostName github.com
  IdentityFile ~/.ssh/github
  UseKeychain yes

{code}

Test connection using port 443.

{code}
#!bash

ssh -vT git@bitbucket.org
#output 
OpenSSH_7.6p1, LibreSSL 2.6.2
debug1: Reading configuration data /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/config
debug1: /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/config line 2: Applying options for bitbucket.org
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 48: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org port 443.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/mybit type 0
debug1: key_load_public: No such file or directory
debug1: identity file /Users/[*username*]/.ssh/mybit-cert type -1
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.6
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host

# I have replaced my username above with [*username*], since I don't want to share that publicly. 
{code}

I have no issues pushing changes using ssh to my GitHub. I am on a public library network at the moment and thought it could be their firewall that is blocking the connection. Given my bitbucket repos are private, could this be the reason? Thanks.
fields.summary: Port 22 and Port 443 connection push connection issues

fields.description:
We have the ability to Filter repository list by owner on Bitbucket Dashboard.\\
The returned list will give us the repo name, owner, project (if applicable) and Last updated date.\\
Would be really good to add the Repository Size on there as well
fields.summary: Add repository Size to the Dashboard view

!1474849819-Untitled.png|thumbnail!

No matter how many times I cancel out of this Dialog box it keeps popping back up, even after closing SourceTree.
fields.summary: No way to cancel Authenticate login dialog box
Custom pipelines for only specific branches

I encountered this problem when pushing my code to Bitbucket. Seems like an old issue that was resolved but happened again. please look into it thanks!

$ git push\\
Counting objects: 18, done.\\

fields.description: As a pipeline user I would like to specify in the pipeline yml file which custom pipeline will be selected by default.
fields.summary: Specify custom pipeline that is selected by default

fields.description: Currently an additional step is a fresh step where we can't use dependencies from the previous one. I m suggesting to have a type of steps which is a continuation of the previous one where we can name it and benefit from the "steps layout" without any artifacts handling.
fields.summary: Carry state automatically into next step, without needing to configure artifacts

fields.description:
I have setup an automated build on Dockerhub, each time it completed building a docker image,  I would like it to trigger Bitbucket pipeline to rerun.

May I know how can I achieve this in Bitbucket? Dockerhub provides webhook for each image completion, but I dont know how to integrate it with Bitbucket
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipeline trigger from dockerhub post webhook?

fields.description:
hi pro\\
We met this issue on a daily change deployment.\\
We use pipeline for couple months and most of time it works fine.

Last day, I noticed this problem: Don't know why it takes more than 2 hours on the build step.\\
I believe it is not caused by our changes (the codes still on bitbucket cloud)\\
Can you kindly answer these two questions?

* Why this happened and How can I avoid this?
* Would these 2 hours counted by our run-time usage?
fields.summary: Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes.

fields.description:
If a secret env variable, FOO, has been configured with the value "bar",\\
and the value "bar" appears in a pipeline step (i.e a completely unrelated use of that word), then the pipeline log will map this "bar" string to "$FOO", in effect revealing the content of FOO to perusers of the log.
fields.summary: Contents of secret env variable are revealed in pipeline log

fields.description:
hello!\\
I have a problem between use bitbucket server .\\
I update bitbucket server from v4.11 to Atlassian Bitbucket v5.6.1. after start server  about 10 minutes later , the server become very slow.   I, ask DBA Analysis of reasons.  get the  message as follows:

h3. bitbucket make the db server CPU used 100%, because of the flower sql:
select internalsc0_.id         as id1_45_,\\
internalsc0_.group_name as group_na2_45_,\\
internalsc0_.perm_id    as perm_id3_45_,\\
internalsc0_.user_id    as user_id4_45_,\\
internalsc0_.project_id as project_1_69_,\\
internalsc0_.repo_id    as repo_id1_75_,\\
internalsc0_.clazz_     as clazz_\\
from (select id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
null       as project_id,\\
null       as repo_id,\\
1          as clazz_\\
from sta_global_permission\\
union\\
select id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
project_id,\\
null       as repo_id,\\
2          as clazz_\\
from sta_project_permission\\
union\\
select id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
null       as project_id,\\
repo_id,\\
3          as clazz_\\
from sta_repo_permission) internalsc0_\\
cross join sta_permission_type internalpe1_\\
where internalsc0_.perm_id = internalpe1_.perm_id\\
and (internalsc0_.user_id is null)\\
and internalsc0_.group_name = 'sgs-gw-core-api-dev'\\
order by id asc limit 1001

h3. DBA Suggestion optimization the sql like：
SELECT\\
internalsc0_.id AS id1_45_,\\
internalsc0_.group_name AS group_na2_45_,\\
internalsc0_.perm_id AS perm_id3_45_,\\
internalsc0_.user_id AS user_id4_45_,\\
internalsc0_.project_id AS project_1_69_,\\
internalsc0_.repo_id AS repo_id1_75_,\\
internalsc0_.clazz_ AS clazz_\\
FROM\\
(\\
SELECT\\
id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
NULL AS project_id,\\
NULL AS repo_id,\\
1 AS clazz_\\
FROM\\
sta_global_permission\\
WHERE\\
group_name = 'sgs-gw-core-api-dev'\\
UNION\\
SELECT\\
id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
project_id,\\
NULL AS repo_id,\\
2 AS clazz_\\
FROM\\
sta_project_permission\\
WHERE\\
group_name = 'sgs-gw-core-api-dev'\\
UNION\\
SELECT\\
id,\\
group_name,\\
perm_id,\\
user_id,\\
NULL AS project_id,\\
repo_id,\\
3 AS clazz_\\
FROM\\
sta_repo_permission\\
WHERE\\
group_name = 'sgs-gw-core-api-dev'

{code}
) internalsc0_
{code}

CROSS JOIN sta_permission_type internalpe1_\\
WHERE\\
internalsc0_.perm_id = internalpe1_.perm_id\\
AND (internalsc0_.user_id IS NULL)\\
ORDER BY\\
id ASC\\
LIMIT 1001

!4081595004-2017-12-26_214138.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: query group permission sql make DB server CPU used 100%

fields.description: I'm faced with a problem, bitbucket api does not provide the ability to save modified files between any two commits in zip. and your help center adviced me to create issue.I think this will be the right addition to your api.Respect!
fields.summary: Add a new function in api

fields.description:
In the article "Publishing a Website on Bitbucket Cloud" there's a bad paragraph:

Each page will be cacached for 15 minutes. This means your changes wont be visibile immediately. You can manually refesh each page in your brower to see the latest version.

The author probably wanted:

s/cacached/cached/\\
s/visibile/visible/\\
s/refesh/refresh/\\
s/wont/won't/

The affected URL is https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/publishing-a-website-on-bitbucket-cloud-221449776.html
fields.summary: Typos in static pages tutorial
Add permissions instructions to SSH Pipelines guide

fields.description:
My problem is that it is hard to go repository in another project from a repository in view page.

To go into a repository in another project, I'm following these steps:

# Click to TeamName on breadcrumb
# Click to Projects icon at left side menu
# Click to target project
# Click to target repository

the proper behaviour could be like this:

* When I reached repository detail page via repository list page, TeamName link on breadcrumb could redirect to repository list page.
* when I reached repository detail page via project list page, TeamName link on breadcrumb could redirect to project list page.
fields.summary: TeamName on Breadcrumb should redirect to project list
